issue.title: Fixes #14 Drops and recreates table when if it exists during initializing only if setClearZookeepers = true in configuration.
issue.body:
...g only if setClearZookeepers = true in configuration.

The more I thought about this, I think the best option is to drop and recreate the table when setClearZookeepers() is enabled and fail otherwise (with the table already exists exception).

body: One thing to take into consideration is that we probably don't want to even bother re-initializing the table if the user says NO to reinitializing Zookeeper.

issue.title: Support multiple tables in a single Fluo instance
issue.body:
Fluo currently supports multiple tables but each table needs to be run in a separate instance.  As the number of tables grow, administration will become an issue.  It would be nicer if a Fluo instance supported multiple tables.  Each table would still have it's own oracle and worker processes (run in YARN as an application).  Therefore, this ticket is different than #22.  However, the admin steps described below could probably remain if #22 is implemented.   

The configuration for all tables could live in one location <zookeeperRoot> in Zookeeper:

```
<zookeeperRoot>/config/
<zookeeperRoot>/tables/table2
<zookeeperRoot>/tables/mytable
```

A single installation of Fluo could be used to administer one instance with multiple tables:

```
fluo-1.0.0-beta/conf/fluo.properties
fluo-1.0.0-beta/conf/tables/mytable.properties
fluo-1.0.0-beta/conf/tables/table2.properties
```

A single script ``fluo-1.0.0-beta/bin/fluo.sh` could be used to administer the instance and all of its tables:

``` bash
./fluo.sh init instance # initalizes instance using fluo.properties
./fluo.sh init <table>  # initializes table
./fluo.sh init --force <table> # forces initialization
./fluo.sh update instance # updates instance config using fluo.properties
./fluo.sh update <table> # updates table config from props in conf/table/
./fluo.sh list  # lists all tables and their status (stopped, started)
./fluo.sh start <table>  # starts processes (oracle and workers) for table in YARN
./fluo.sh stop <table> # stops processes for for table in YARN
./fluo.sh start all # starts all tables in ZK
./fluo.sh stop all # stops all tables in ZK
```

issue.title: Make re-initialization easier for users
issue.body:
Wanted to initialize a different fluo table, but got confused when the new fluo admin table I configured didn't get created. Eventually, I assumed this was because ZooKeeper was already initialized and it was just bailing out.

A couple of things would be nice:
- Print a message when `bin/initialize.sh` isn't actually doing anything
- Remove the option from `fluo.properties` to reinitialize, make it a command-line option instead (with a nice help message, too)

issue.title: Closes #198 #244 - Improve how 'fluo init' handles existing Fluo instance
issue.body:
...and make initialization easier for users

Pull request for #198 & #244
